qas.question: Who did the modern orthodoxy arise from?
What do most Jews consider modern orthodoxy today?
the neo-orthodox movement holds that who's views are not accurately followed by the mordern orthodoxy?
Who believe that Modern Orthodoxy arose from Eastern European Jewry?
What is not considered traditional today by most Jews?
Who considers modern orthodoxy to have completely valid elements?
Who holds that Hirsch's views are accurate?
What is classical Orthodoxy considered by the Western European Jewry?

context: Some <b3_0>scholars<b3_0/> believe that Modern Orthodoxy arose from the religious and social realities of <a0_0>Western European Jewry<a0_0/>. While most Jews consider <b4_0>Modern Orthodoxy<b4_0/> <a1_0><b7_0>traditional<b7_0/><a1_0/> today, some <b5_0>(the hareidi and hasidic<b5_0/> groups) within the Orthodox community consider some elements to be of questionable validity. The <b6_0>neo-Orthodox movement<b6_0/> holds that <a2_0>Hirsch's<a2_0/> views are not accurately followed by Modern Orthodoxy. [See Torah im Derech Eretz and Torah Umadda "Relationship with Torah im Derech Eretz" for a more extensive listing.]
